content: <1>{{displayName}}</1> wants to share with you the contact of the guest.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a personalized message when a user receives an invitation from a guest. It will show the name of the guest who shared the contact information. This appears in a greeting component on the login page.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Czech translation preserves the original English tags '<1>' and '{{{displayName}}}'. These tags are likely meant for processing and should be removed or adapted to the Czech localization system.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags: "<1>" and "{{{displayName}}}". Replace with a localized equivalent if needed. Example: "{{displayName}} chce s vámi sdílet kontakt na hosta."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation includes an article (Ο/Η) before the display name. While grammatically correct, it's unclear whether this was intentional based on the English source which does not include an article. It might be safer to omit it to match the English source more closely.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the article 'Ο/Η' for closer alignment with the English source.  Alternatively, if the Greek version absolutely requires it, ensure it's consistently applied.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ձեզ հետ կիսվել" (dzez het kiselvel) literally translates to "share with you". A more natural and idiomatic way to express 'share with you the contact of the guest' would be something like 'Ձեզ մատուցել հյուրի կոնտակտային տվյալները' (Dzez matuce h’yuri kontaktain tvyalner) which means 'provide you with the guest's contact information'.  Or, a simpler option: 'Ձեզ հանձնել հյուրի կոնտակտային տվյալները' (dzez handznel h’yuri kontaktain tvyalner) - 'give you the guest’s contact information'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ձեզ մատուցել հյուրի կոնտակտային տվյալները or Ձեզ հանձնել հյուրի կոնտակտային տվյալները

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "さんがゲストの連絡先をあなたと共有したいと思っています" is a bit too formal and verbose for a guest invitation notification. It sounds more like a formal announcement than a casual notification.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural and concise phrasing, such as "{{displayName}}さんがゲストの連絡先を共有してほしいと言っています" or "{{displayName}}さんがゲストの連絡先をあなたとシェアしたいようです".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags `<1>` and `</1>` are inconsistent with common practices. They appear to be wrapping the display name, but their purpose is unclear.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm with the original content provider if these tags are intentional. If they are intended to format the name in a specific way, ensure the tags are consistently used and correct. Otherwise, remove them as they are redundant.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "wants to share with you" is too literal. A more natural phrasing in Korean would be "초대하고 싶어합니다" (cho-dae-ha-go sipeo hamnida) or "초대하고 싶어합니다" (cho-dae-ha-go sipeo hamnida) rather than "공유하길 원합니다" (gong-yu-ha-gil wonhapnida), which is more formal and less common in this context.
The spacing before and after the Korean translation text is inconsistent with the English original.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent spacing around the translated content to match the original English formatting.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ar jums ar viesa kontaktiem" is awkward and less natural in Latvian. It literally translates to "with you with the guest's contacts." A better phrasing would convey the intention of sharing the guest's contact information.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rewording to something like "vēlas dalīties ar jums viesa kontaktu" (wants to share with you the guest's contact) or "vēlas ar jums dalīties viesa kontaktiem" (wants to share the guest's contacts with you).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'contact' is translated as 'datele de contat'. 'Contact' should be translated as 'contactul'.

The English phrase "wants to share with you the contact of the guest" is not accurately translated.  'Share the contact' is too literal. A more natural Sinhala phrasing would express the intent of inviting the user to view or access the guest's contact information.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Possible suggestions:  'ඔබ සමඟ අමුත්තාගේ සම්බන්ධතා තොරතුරු බෙදා ගැනීමට කැමතියි' (Oba samaa amuththaage santhapaathathoru berbagiakathakiya kamitiya) - '{{displayName}} wants to share the guest's contact information with you.' or 'ඔබට අමුත්තාගේ සම්බන්ධතාවය දැකීමට {{displayName}} කැමතියි' (Obata amuththaage santhapaathaya dekima {{displayName}} kamitiya) - '{{displayName}} wants you to see the guest's contact.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'жели да подели са вама контакт госта' is not a natural or accurate translation of 'wants to share with you the contact of the guest.'  'Жели' is archaic and doesn't convey 'wants' correctly.  'Са вама' is also not standard Serbian. The best equivalent of 'wants to share with you' would be 'жели да подели са вама'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: жели да подели са вама контакт госта.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure and word order in the translation are slightly awkward and not idiomatic for standard Serbian. While understandable, it lacks the flow of natural Serbian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: жели да подели са вама контакт госта.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'konuğun iletişim bilgilerini' is a bit awkward. 'Misafir' is a more common and natural word for 'guest' in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Use 'Misafir' instead of 'Konuğun'. A better translation would be: '<1>{{displayName}}</1> sizinle misafirin iletişim bilgilerini paylaşmak istiyor.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are present in the Vietnamese translation, mirroring the English. This might not be necessary or idiomatic in Vietnamese and could indicate a formatting issue related to how the translation was processed or intended to be displayed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags from the Vietnamese translation. The content should be presented directly as "{{displayName}} muốn chia sẻ với bạn thông tin liên hệ của khách."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The opening and closing tags <1> are present in both the English and Chinese versions, but they don't seem to serve a specific purpose and might be unnecessary.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the <1> tags if they are just placeholders or have no functional meaning.
